heading: Miheeka Bajaj makes seashell jewellery look cool for her haldi ceremony
summary: Rana Daggubati and Miheeka Bajaj are all set to tie the knot on august 8. The wedding ceremony will be bio-secure and will have a special theme on the day before the lockdown was announced. He will get married to the couple on july 8 in january, which will take place in the city of london on september 25 - november 20 – october 20.

heading: Music producer Detail accused of sexual assault
summary: Detail, whose real name is Noel Christopher Fisher, was arrested on more than a dozen charges of sexual assault. The 41-year-old producer was held on nearly USD 6.3 million (Rs 47,18,38,500) bail, according to the los Angeles County Sheriff?s Department. He is accused of crimes between 2010 and 2018.Detectives submitted the case to l.a. District attorney's office in January, the statement said.

heading: Celebrated author Sadia Dehlvi dies at 63 in Delhi
summary: Noted writer and activist Sadia Dehlvi died at her home on friday. She was admitted to a city hospital recently and was undergoing treatment, she died on tuesday at 63. Her grandfather, Hafiz Yusuf, founded in 1938 Shama, an iconic Urdu film and literary monthly. Sad to hear about the tragic demise of her beloved, eminent historian S Irfan Habib.

heading: Neena is a legit fashionista in new pic
summary: The actress is a fashionista and her social media game is so on-point that she can easily leave behind the millennials. The 65-year-old captioned the image,?self.?View this post on InstagramSelfA post shared by Neena Gupta on Aug 5, 2020 at 1:46am PDT - the hilarious part of the post is her daughter and designer Masaba guaya's comment.

heading: UK judge rules Meghan's friends can stay anonymous in privacy case
summary: A judge rules the duchess of Sussex can keep the names of five close friends secret.

heading: Milind and Ankita's loved-up pic is curing our mid-week blues. Seen?
summary: Ankita posted a selfie with the supermodel on her Instagram stories. She shared her secret of staying positive and self-love with her fans, including her instagram account, and her secrets of being positive. If something or someone makes you uncomfortable, take an pause, observe your emotions towards it and let it go with an positive thought. You can walk out of negativity without holding anything against it. Learn how to peacefully walk away from negativeity.

heading: Meet Aishwarya Sheoran, Miss India finalist and UPSC Rank 93
summary: The union public service Commission announced the results for the Civil Services Exam 2019 on august 4. The internet was flooded with success stories of many aspirants, but one particular person has caught the netizen?s eye and that too for a brilliant reason.

heading: What is the future of fashion shows?
summary: The fashion industry is trying to adapt to the 'new normal' this year. It's the first time a designer has showcased his collection at the digital Paris Haute Couture Week in July 2014. He also presented 13 looks in an film. But, temporarily. The online showcases have allowed us to compensate for some major plus-points of digital fashion shows. In fact, only ten seconds can zoom in to all the details the designer wants to showcase.

heading: Mandira Bedi wants you to do something today that makes you happy
summary: Mandira Bedi's Instagram account is filled with messages of hope, faith and joy. She shared a message for her fans and followers in the caption of her post on friday. "do something today that makes you happy," she said in her caption. 'i love yourself and choose to be happy.' she often shares beautiful pictures of herself with motivational captions.you must see these!View this post in InstagramFeeling ready. To take on the world.

heading: Google Pixel 3a series discontinued in US: Pixel 4a coming soon?
summary: Google has discontinued the Pixel 4a and Pixel 3a XL in the us nearly a year after they were launched as the watered-down versions of the phone. This should indicate that the company is preparing for the arrival of this series that has been in anticipation more than everyone expected.

heading: BSNL extends availability of Rs 299, Rs 491 ADSL broadband plans for 90 days, introduces PV 2399
summary: Bsnl has extended the availability of ADSL broadband plans worth Rs 299 and Rs 491 for a period of 90 days, starting 27th June. The plans dubbed as 50GB CUL will be available till september, beginning with the release of the work-at-home plan for its users until July 26. Both plans require users to pay Rs 500 as

heading: Nikon will introduce entry-level Nikon Z5 and three Nikkor Z lenses on July 21
summary: Rumours suggest the company will announce the Nikon Z5 along with new lenses. These lenses will be a part of Nikkor Z series lenses including the much-awaited f/2.8 S. This lens may come with screw-on feature for putting on additional filters. The new camera M10-R may launch on July 19 via live streams in the US

heading: Asus ROG Phone 3 finally gets a release date: Everything you need to know
summary: The Asus ROG Phone 3 will be launched on July 22, 2020, at the game changer event. The company is better known for making gaming laptops and gaming smartphones, especially the ROg series. It will lock horns with Lenovo Legion gaming smartphone which is also slated to launch this year.

heading: Pakistan temporarily bans PUBG, calls it addictive and wastage of time
summary: Pubg has also been cited as one of the reasons for cases of suicide in Pakistan. The temporary ban comes days after india clutched down on 59 Chinese apps and banned them.

heading: Facebook admits sharing users' data with third-party developers
summary: 5000 third-party app developers continued to receive non-public information about users way longer than they should have. The company didn?t receive the number of users who had used the app for the past 90 days. It just revealed personal information including addresses, birthdays, gender, or language spoken was wrongly shared with the apps.

heading: BSNL reintroduces Work at Home plan till 26th July, extends 6 paise cashback offer till 31st July
summary: The work-at-home plan is available in all circles except for the Andaman and Nicobar circles. New subscribers will get 10 Mbps speed till 5GB data per day, the speed is reduced to 1 mbps - the download and upload limit is unlimited with customers getting 1 free e-mail ID and a GB space. heading: Zuckerberg tells Facebook employees that boycotting advertisers will be back soon enough, won?t change policies
summary: Facebook CEO says he won?t change the policies of the company. This was in response to more than 500 advertisers boycotting Facebook as part of?Stop hate for Profit? movement - a threat to small percent of our revenue, or to any percentage of your revenue... Zuckerberg said 'all these advertisers will be back soon enough'

heading: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra images leak, spotted in Mystic Bronze colour
summary: The phone was spotted in?Mystic Bronze? colour, and complete with a triple camera setup on the back. The new leaked images also show the S Pen. There appear to be no real surprises here, with the stylus looking the same as always.

heading: Google Play Store, App Store remove all 59 Chinese apps banned by government?
summary: The list of apps that were banned by the government included UC browser, Shareit, Kwai, CamScanner and others. The apps were nowhere to be found in Apple?s App Store as well, but now there are absolutely no traces of the other 58 apps banned in India.

heading: DuckDuckGo privacy-focused search engine inaccessible in India, company says could be blocked
summary: The privacy-centric search engine seems to be unresponsive on all networks, according to several users in India on Twitter and Reddit. A number of twitter users took to Twitter to report that DuckDuckGo is inaccessible for them on multiple networks - including Reliance Jio and Airtel. heading: OnePlus Nord to bring 5G-enabled Snapdragon 765G SoC, 'flagship-level' cameras, confirms company
summary: The OnePlus Nord will come with a powerful mid-range chipset, the Snapdragon 765G. The information has now been confirmed by Qualcomm's twitter handle and corroborated by u.s. Co-founder, Carl Pei, who in an interview with TechRadar UK, confirmed the device will be powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 750G chips
